question:
Which among the following is / are the fundamental duties enshrined in the Constitution of India?
1. To renounce practices derogatory to the dignity of women
2. To follow the noble ideals which inspired our national struggle for freedom
3. To protect and improve the environment, forests and wild life of the country
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
Kindly note the third statement. It is something both in DPSP and Fundamental Duties. Among DPSP, article 48A says: The State shall endeavour to protect and improve the environment and to safeguard the forests and wild life of the country. Among fundamental duties, its 51 (g )
  • to protect and improve the natural environment including forests, lakes, rivers and wild life, and to have compassion for living creatures;
